doc.name: pageRanges
doc.summary: Splits the content of a field into pages based on the height of a field.

examples.example: put the pageRanges of field "chapter" into tPageCount

description.overview: Use the pageRanges property to split field content into pages based on the height of the field.
description.value: Returns a list of char ranges, one per line.
description.comments:
The pageRanges property (notionally) splits up the field content into pages based on the height of the field, and then returns a return-delimited list of char ranges. Each char range corresponds to an individual page.
For example, for a field capable of displaying two lines of text and containing these lines:
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
Line 4
Line 5
Line 6
The pageRanges would return:
1,14
15,28
29,42
